intro: Masdevallia expers, commonly known as the velvet orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure and its intricate, velvety-textured leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, often arranged in a raceme. It thrives in cool, humid environments with indirect light and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
